Title: Computer science - enabling a data-driven world
Description: The rise of robotics, artificial intelligence, smart devices and the Internet of Things, along with the widespread use of machine learning over traditional algorithms, has revolutionised computer science. The modern computer scientist needs to understand the devices that generate data, the software and algorithms that consume data, and the application of these techniques to solve challenging problems that face communities, nations and the planet as a whole. In this session, you?ll be introduced to some exciting topics covered in our computer science course, taking you on the journey from devices to data and connecting you with an exciting new data-driven world.
Location: Building X, Room X2.05, Lecture Theatre 12

Title: Exercise and sport science
Description: Our exercise and sport science program is professionally accredited and explores the physical health, wellbeing and performance of individuals, elite athletes and teams through training, coaching, research and more. Deakin is the #1 ranked sport science school in the world and puts you on the path to becoming an elite sport scientist working with athletes or elite sporting teams.
Location: Building HC, Room HC2.005, Lecture Theatre 13

Title: Exercise and sport science
Description: Our exercise and sport science program is professionally accredited and explores the physical health, wellbeing and performance of individuals, elite athletes and teams through training, coaching, research and more. Title: Exercise and sport science lab tour
Description: Observe the effects of impact force on Bob the punching man (our test dummy), which helps us to understand the effects of concussion and impact trauma in sport. Visualise how we use oxygen and the effects that strenuous physical exercise can have with our VO2 max demonstration. Put your reaction speed to the test in our 3D Gait timing reaction drill. Tours every half hour from 9.30am.
Location: Career and Course Information Centre

Title: Film and television studio

Our accredited financial planning courses enable you to enter a financially rewarding profession, which has the potential to transform the lives of the people you work with. New changes in legislation will provide significant job opportunities going forward for suitably qualified financial planners.

Description: See creative paintings by maggots. Learn how maggots are being used to research the relationship between blowflies, maggots and bacteria, while watching them produce cool artwork.
Location: Building M, Room M3.109, Physiology Laboratory

Title: Management
Description: Management is a major in our Bachelor of Commerce. It has a strong practical focus, providing work-integrated learning opportunities and developing the skills you need to get the job you want.

Students experience a classroom without walls. Hear how fieldwork and industry placements prepare you for a rewarding career.
Location: Building X, Room X2.05, Lecture Theatre 12

Title: Marketing
Description: Offered as a major in our business degrees, marketing develops knowledge and skills in strategy, research, integrated marketing communication, analysis and planning, branding, advertising, public relations, implementation and consumer behaviour.

Description: Looking for a career change? Come and hear about this postgraduate initial teacher qualification and how it will equip you with the skills and experience to work in secondary schools and other youth settings, such as VCAL and TAFE.
Location: Building HE, Room HE1.009

Title: Master of Teaching
Description: Looking for a career change? The Master of Teaching enables graduates from various disciplines to gain teaching qualifications in one of early childhood, primary or secondary education strands, or dual qualifications in primary/early childhood or primary/secondary.
Location: Building HE, Room HE1.009

Title: Master of Teaching
Description: Looking for a career change? The Master of Teaching enables graduates from various disciplines to gain teaching qualifications in one or two of three strands: early childhood, primary or secondary education.

Description: Our medical imaging course integrates both academic and clinical studies throughout the course. Learn through problem-based seminars and practical classes before undergoing intensive clinical training within professional health services across Victoria.

Description: Visit our purpose-built learning spaces and simulated clinical spaces, which closely replicate hospital and community environments. Description: Visit our food sensory labs at the Centre for Advanced Sensory Science (CASS). Participate in various food demonstrations, sample different freeze dried foods, marvel at surface bacterial swabs and learn about different manufacturing and packaging techniques.

Title: Nutrition sciences
Description: Our nutrition course explores the vital role of food and nutrition in human health and disease prevention. You?ll be equipped to pursue a pathway into dietetics or work as a nutritional specialist in a range of industry sectors, such as government, private, community or population health.

Description: Our occupational therapy course gives you the specialised knowledge to improve clients? lives every day, as well as the skills to promote good health and wellbeing. Description: Deakin's Cloud Campus is supported by outstanding online resources and digital tools - your classroom in the cloud is where you'll take classes, submit assessments and participate in discussions. Find out more.

Title: Optometry
Description: Our 3.5-year accelerated optometry course is a specialised combined degree that focuses on detecting, managing and treating eye disease and supplying corrective solutions. It leads to registration as an optometrist and provides graduates with the discipline-specific knowledge required to practise as an optometrist throughout Australia and New Zealand.
Location: Building B, Room B3.05, Lecture Theatre 4

Title: Optometry
Description: Our 3.5-year accelerated optometry course is a specialised combined degree that focuses on detecting, managing and treating eye disease and supplying corrective solutions. It leads to registration as an optometrist and provides graduates with the discipline-specific knowledge required to practise as an optometrist throughout Australia and New Zealand.
Location: Building B, Room B3.05, Lecture Theatre 4

Title: Pathway to Deakin - Deakin College
Description: Diploma courses include commerce, computing, engineering, health sciences, management, media and communication and science - pathway into second year at Deakin.
Location: Building HD, Rooms HD3.008 and HD3.009

Title: Pathways to Deakin
Description: Learn more about our partnerships and alternate pathways to starting your dream degree at Deakin.
Location: Building HD, Rooms HD3.008 and HD3.009

Title: Pathways to Deakin
Description: Learn more about our partnerships and alternate pathways to starting your dream degree at Deakin.
Location: Building HD, Rooms HD3.008 and HD3.009

Title: Philosophy and studies of religions
Description: Philosophy - challenge your thinking and explore the fundamental questions of human existence; Studies of religions - inform and change how you think about religion.
Location: Building BC, Burwood Corporate Centre, Level 2, East 1

Title: Photography
Description: Interested in a creative career? Our unique approach to the creative arts allows you to specialise in photography, with access to outstanding facilities and a team of academics with extensive industry experience.
Location: Building P, Room P1.03

Title: Photography studio and print lab demonstrations
Description: Join the photography team for a tour of our state-of-the-art digital and analogue facilities, including a demonstration of our rapid digital workflow from capture and print to installation.
Location: Building P, Rooms P4.15, P4.17 and P4.19

Title: Photography studio and print lab demonstrations
Description: Join the photography team for a tour of our state-of-the-art digital and analogue facilities, including a demonstration of our rapid digital workflow from capture and print to installation.
Location: Building BC, Burwood Corporate Centre, Level 2, North 1-3

Title: Politics and policy studies, international relations, international politics, Middle East studies
Description: Learn how studying contemporary international politics and related disciplines can increase your job opportunities and equip you with the skills to make a change in the world.
Location: Building BC, Burwood Corporate Centre, Level 2, North 1-3

Title: Portfolio skills workshop
Description: Looking for a career in the creative or communication industries? This is an opportunity not to be missed. Gain handy tips and insights to enhance and develop your portfolio.
Location: Building P, Room P1.28

Title: Postgraduate studies - communication and creative arts
Description: Expand your skills and diversify your reach in the creative arts or communication by undertaking a graduate certificate, graduate diploma or master's degree. Perfect for artists looking to deepen their critical art practice or those who are working in the communications industry or looking for a career change.
Location: Building P, Room P1.03

Title: Postgraduate studies - cultural heritage and museum studies
Description: Develop the knowledge, research skills and practical experience to make a difference in the cultural heritage sector. You may want to work with collections, manage a museum or heritage site, or protect and interpret significant sites. If you're a mid-career professional or looking for a unique career change, come along to learn more.
Location: Building BC, Burwood Corporate Centre, Level 2, East 2

Title: Postgraduate studies - international and community development
Description: Development programs to promote justice, reduce poverty and build environments for people to lead productive, creative and fulfilling lives. If you have compassion and empathy and want to see a better world, this course is for you.
Location: Building BC, Burwood Corporate Centre, Level 2, East 2

Title: Primary teaching
Description: Discover the rewards of studying a primary teaching degree. Hear our friendly staff discussing selection, course information and career options.
Location: Building I, Room I2.02, Lecture Theatre 1

Title: Property and real estate
Description: Property and real estate is practical, profitable and in-demand. Deakin delivers Victoria's only three-year property course with Certified Practising Valuer (CPV) accreditation.
Location: Building LB, Room LB2.308

Title: Psychology
Description: Our psychology course exposes you to the biological, developmental, social and cognitive factors that affect the way humans think, feel and behave. Studying psychology puts you on the path to becoming a registered psychologist equipped to work in a range of psychology fields, such as clinical, forensic, organisational, educational, health and more.
Location: Building B, Room B1.77, Lecture Theatre 3

Title: Psychology
Description: Our psychology course exposes you to the biological, developmental, social and cognitive factors that affect the way humans think, feel and behave. Studying psychology puts you on the path to becoming a registered psychologist equipped to work in a range of psychology fields, such as clinical, forensic, organisational, educational, health and more.
Location: Building B, Room B1.77, Lecture Theatre 3

Title: Psychology labs
Description: Explore our clinical psychology labs and witness demonstrations of the application and monitoring of magnetic stimulation to a subject's brain and the effects this has on their hand-motor region and brain wave electrograph. Tours every half hour from 10.00 am
Location: Building BC, Level 1

Title: Public health and health promotion
Description: Our public health and health promotion course gives you the skills to tackle big-picture population health problems. Develop invaluable skills in program planning and evaluation, health education, community engagement and policy development and analysis.
Location: Building I, Room I2.05, Lecture Theatre 2

Title: Primary teaching
Description: Discover the rewards of studying a primary teaching degree. Hear our friendly staff discussing selection, course information and career options.
Location: Building I, Room I2.05, Lecture Theatre 2

Title: Public relations
Description: Public relations is about professional and strategic communication. An occupation with global reach and opportunities, our PR graduates enjoy exciting careers here and overseas.
Location: Building P, Creative Media Lab, Room P3.04

Title: Public health and health promotion
Description: Our public health and health promotion course gives you the skills to tackle big-picture population health problems. Develop invaluable skills in program planning and evaluation, health education, community engagement and policy development and analysis.
Location: Building B, Room B1.20, Lecture Theatre 11

Title: Renewable energy
Description: Come and speak to Deakin electrical and electronic engineering lecturers about Deakin?s exciting developments in renewable energy.
Location: Building T

Title: Returning to study - mature-age students and non-Year 12 students
Description: Looking to return to study? This session provides a guide on choosing the right course for you and tips on how to navigate the application process. Learn how study can suit your lifestyle, with flexible delivery options to help juggle work and family commitments.
Location: Building HE, Room HE1.014

Title: Secondary teaching
Description: Find out about the pathways to your career as a secondary teacher. Learn about selection, course information and career options.
Location: Building I, Room I2.02, Lecture Theatre 1

Title: Secondary teaching - arts
Description: Find out about the pathways to your career as a secondary teacher. Learn about selection, course information and career options.
Location: Building I, Room I2.02, Lecture Theatre 1

Title: Secondary teaching - science
Description: Find out about the pathways to your career as a secondary science teacher. Learn about selection, course information and career options.
Location: Building I, Room I2.02, Lecture Theatre 1

Title: Science
Description: Not just about lab work, science at Deakin provides practical hands-on learning experiences, including field trips, industry learning and the establishment of valuable networks. You can elect your specialisation and choose to study science with a degree in commerce, teaching, law or arts.
Location: Building I, Room I2.07, Lecture Theatre 1A

Title: Science display
Description: Come and see an interactive display highlighting our study areas in the life sciences.
Location: Building M, Room M2.109, Physiology Laboratory

Title: Social work
Description: Our social work program is accredited with the Australian Association of Social Workers and gives graduates the opportunity to have a rewarding career working with individuals, families, communities and organisations. It is designed around real world experience with students completing more than 1000 hours of practical placement.
Location: Building I, Room I2.05, Lecture Theatre 2

Title: Sociology
Description: Study the people around you. The rich, the poor, the strong, the weak, the powerful, the oppressed and all in between. Learn to change the way you see the world.
Location: Building BC, Burwood Corporate Centre, Level 2, East 1

Title: Software engineering - engineering a smarter future
Description: Software engineers are shaping the way we experience life, with innovative solutions for cars, homes, cities, health care and even space. Learn how our innovative software engineering (honours) course prepares you to operate at the intersection of software development and systems engineering, applying specialised robotics and cyber-physical computing skills to drive the design and development of computing solutions that operate within and interact with people, environments and other technologies.
Location: Building X, Room X2.05, Lecture Theatre 12

Title: Sport management and sport development
Description: A world leader in tertiary sport courses, sport management provides industry-specific and business training, while sport development focuses on participation, pathways and the benefits of community sport.
Location: Building HC, Room HC2.005, Lecture Theatre 13

Title: Sport management and sport development
Description: A world leader in tertiary sport courses, sport management provides industry-specific and business training, while sport development focuses on participation, pathways and the benefits of community sport.
Location: Building HC, Room HC2.005, Lecture Theatre 13

Title: Sport management and sport development
Description: A world leader in tertiary sport courses, sport management provides industry-specific and business training, while sport development focuses on participation, pathways and the benefits of community sport.
Location: Building HC, Room HC2.005, Lecture Theatre 13

Title: Teaching science - science education labs
Description: Discover why teaching science and technology in today?s classroom is an exciting and challenging activity. Participate in activities, discover contemporary STEM teaching and challenge yourself to design a new solution, all in our new science education labs.
Location: Building M, Education Science Lab, Rooms M1.103 and M1.105

Title: Student exhibition
Description: Enjoy displays of student work from visual communication design, visual arts, photography, animation and more in our impressive gallery space.
Location: Building B, Room B1.70, Phoenix Gallery

Title: Take a library tour
Description: Our modern libraries will be open and offering tours on request. Discover what makes our students love our libraries and learn about the spaces, facilities and services available.
Location: Building JC, Level 2

Title: Teaching the arts in schools - facilities tour
Description: Tour our facilities for arts education and get a glimpse into the amazing hands-on teaching and learning experiences enjoyed by our primary and secondary teaching students.
Location: Building E, Foyer, Level 1

Title: The Poescope - writing and literature hub
Location: Building P, Level 1 (outside)

Title: Teaching the arts in schools - facilities tour
Description: Tour our facilities for arts education and get a glimpse into the amazing hands-on teaching and learning experiences enjoyed by our primary and secondary teaching students.
Location: Building E, Foyer, Level 1

Title: Telstra Trading Room - open for trading sessions
Description: Come and explore Deakin's Telstra Trading Room, which is a high-tech, innovative teaching space that operates like an interbank FX trading floor. You will have the opportunity to see students simulating the fast-paced nature of the trading world.
Location: Building LB, Room LB2.301, Telstra Trading Room

Title: Visual arts
Description: Learn an array of visual art techniques, including contemporary drawing, painting and 3D modelling. Develop a solid knowledge of contemporary art theory and combine cutting-edge theory with specialised studio practice.
Location: Building P, Room P1.03

Title: Visual arts gallery
Description: Visit Deakin's new visual arts studio to see the amazing work of our visual arts students.
Location: Building HD, Room HD2.006, Richard Searby Room, Visual Arts Studio

Title: Visual arts studio
Description: See the amazing work of our visual arts students and learn about the creative process.
Location: Building P, Room P2.02, Visual Arts Studio

Title: Under the microscope lens
Description: Enjoy the opportunity to learn how a microscope works and look down a microscope and see things in our world larger than ever before.
Location: Building M, Room M2.109

Title: Understanding VTAC's SEAS
Description: Information about VTAC's Special Entry and Access Scheme (SEAS), including the application process, different SEAS categories and how SEAS impacts on university selection. Ask questions of our specialists.
Location: Building HD, Rooms HD3.008 and HD3.009

Title: Why choose Deakin?
Description: Come and hear why Deakin is the best place to study and how students are prepared for future career opportunities. Get tips on how to make the most of your Open day visit - a presentation for students and parents.
Location: Building HD, Rooms HD3.008 and HD3.009

Title: Why choose Deakin?
Description: Come and hear why Deakin is the best place to study and how students are prepared for future career opportunities. Get tips on how to make the most of your Open day visit - a presentation for students and parents.
Location: Building HD, Rooms HD3.008 and HD3.009

Title: Why study architecture and construction management?
Description: Find out what's distinctive about our courses, why staff are passionate about teaching and why you should choose to study architecture and the built environment at Deakin's Geelong Waterfront Campus.
Location: Building B, Room B1.20, Lecture Theatre 11

Title: Wildlife and conservation biology, environmental sustainability
Description: Environmental management focuses on finding sustainable solutions to the world's most pressing environmental problems. Wildlife and conservation biology offers theoretical and practical experience in wildlife ecology, landscape and vegetation management, biodiversity and conservation, animal biology and wildlife research, leading to an exciting range of careers.
Location: Building I, Room I2.07, Lecture Theatre 1A

Title: Wildlife and conservation biology, environmental sustainability
Description: Environmental management focuses on finding sustainable solutions to the world's most pressing environmental problems. Wildlife and conservation biology offers theoretical and practical experience in wildlife ecology, landscape and vegetation management, biodiversity and conservation, animal biology and wildlife research, leading to an exciting range of careers.
Location: Building X, Room X2.05, Lecture Theatre 12

Title: Writing and literature
Description: Learn about the world of writing and literature through a dynamic panel discussion.
Location: Building P, Room P1.28

Title: You design Deakin - Deakin merchandise
Description: Come and vote for your favourite vintage design for our student t-shirt design competition. Great prizes to be won.
Location: Career and Course Information Centre

Title: Zoology and animal science
Description: Study animal diversity, ecology and behaviour, comparative physiology, biochemistry, genetics, evolutionary biology and animal nutrition, with hands-on experience using native Australian fauna and ecosystems.
Location: Building X, Room X2.05, Lecture Theatre 12
